meanings.definition: A person who fears, dislikes, or avoids new technology.
meanings.sent1: My grandma is a technophobe and prefers to use a landline phone instead of a smartphone.
meanings.sent2: The technophobe in our office always asks for help when using the new computer software.
meanings.sent3: The technophobe's reaction to the self-driving car was to insist on driving their old manual car instead.
meanings.sent4: The young technophobe viewed the internet as a dark forest full of unknown dangers.
meanings.sent5: The technophobe's fear of technology was so intense that they refused to even touch a tablet.

meanings.definition: One who is resistant to or has a strong aversion to technology.
meanings.sent1: The technophobe's reluctance to use email made communication difficult in the digital age.
meanings.sent2: As a technophobe, he preferred reading physical books over using e-readers.
meanings.sent3: The technophobe's toaster was so old-fashioned, it required manual flipping of the bread.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a fortress, guarded by the walls of a technophobe's skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The technophobe's aversion to smartphones was so strong, they still used a flip phone from the early 2000s.
